Marco Baroni wrote:

> I saw in the faqs that this is a common problem, that can be solved by
> increasing the heritrix file descriptor limit in
>
> /etc/security/limits.conf
>
> Which I did:
>
> @heritrix     hard    nofile  32768
>
> (I have a user heritrix belonging to the group heritrix.)
>
> Now, since I keep having the same problems (warnings and crawling becoming
> very slow), I am planning to further increase that limit. Is there any
> counter-indication to use a really huge value as file descriptor number
> upper bound?

32k should be more than sufficent.  In heritrix_out.log, before the 
crawler starts, it prints out its ulimits settings.  Does it say that 
you are entitled to 32k filehandles in the heritrix_out.log?
St.Ack
